episodeTitle: The Greatest Pirate Fleet! Commodore Don Krieg!
episodeTitleJapanese: 最強の海賊艦隊！提督ドン・クリーク
episodeTitleRomanized: Saikyō no Kaizoku Kantai! Teitoku Don Kurīku
description: Don Krieg arrives at the Baratie with Gin, starving and begging for food. Despite warnings from the staff, Sanji feeds the notorious pirate. Once regained his strength, Krieg betrays the restaurant and launches an invasion, demanding the ship and food for his crew.

events.title: Sanji Attempts to Charm Nami
events.description: Sanji prepares a special fruit macedonia dessert for Nami, showcasing his cooking skills and his immediate infatuation with her. This leads to a comedic moment highlighting Sanji's character trait of being overly attentive to women.
events.significance: Establishes the ongoing dynamic of Sanji's romantic interest in Nami, a recurring character trait throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji presenting his dessert to Nami with exaggerated enthusiasm

events.title: Sanji and Zeff Argument
events.description: Sanji gets into a heated argument with Zeff about his behavior and priorities at the restaurant. The tension reveals the complex father-son-like relationship between the head chef and his protégé.
events.significance: Further develops the complicated but caring relationship between Sanji and Zeff, showing their constant bickering masks deeper respect and affection.

events.title: Don Krieg's Fleet Appears in Fog
events.description: A dense fog rolls in over the Baratie, and the silhouette of Don Krieg's damaged flagship emerges. The restaurant patrons immediately recognize the threat and flee in terror, abandoning their meals.
events.significance: Creates dramatic tension and establishes Don Krieg as a feared antagonist whose reputation alone causes panic. Sets up the central conflict of this episode.

events.title: Don Krieg's First Full Appearance
events.description: Don Krieg, the admiral of the East Blue's most powerful pirate fleet, enters the Baratie in a weakened and starving state alongside Gin. Despite his condition, his golden armor and imposing presence command attention.
events.significance: Introduction of a major arc villain. Krieg is presented as the most powerful pirate in the East Blue with a fleet of 5,000 men and 50 ships, establishing the scale of threat facing the Baratie.

quotes.text: I am Don Krieg, admiral of the pirate fleet. I command 5,000 men and 50 ships.
quotes.speaker: Don Krieg
quotes.context: Krieg introducing himself to the Baratie staff

events.title: Krieg Begs for Food
events.description: Despite his fearsome reputation, Don Krieg humbles himself and begs the Baratie staff for food and water, promising not to attack the restaurant if they feed him. The staff, particularly Patty, are skeptical and hostile.
events.significance: Sets up the central moral dilemma of the episode - whether to show mercy to a starving enemy. Tests Sanji's philosophy about feeding the hungry regardless of who they are.

quotes.text: Please... just give us food and water. I promise we won't attack your ship.
quotes.speaker: Don Krieg

events.title: Krieg's Reputation and Methods Revealed
events.description: The Baratie staff explains Don Krieg's notorious reputation as 'Foul-Play Krieg' who uses deception, trickery, and overwhelming military might to win battles. They detail his ruthless tactics including fake surrenders and poison gas attacks.
events.significance: Establishes Krieg's character as a villain who wins through deception rather than honor, contrasting with the more straightforward pirates encountered so far. Foreshadows his eventual betrayal.

quotes.text: That's Don Krieg for you - the king of dirty tricks. He doesn't believe in honor or fair fights.
quotes.speaker: Patty
quotes.context: Patty warning others about Krieg's treacherous nature

events.title: Sanji Decides to Feed Krieg
events.description: Against the wishes and warnings of all the Baratie staff, Sanji makes the decision to feed Don Krieg. He brings out a bowl of fried rice, standing by his conviction that a cook's duty is to feed anyone who is hungry.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's unwavering principles and compassion, even toward enemies. This moment defines Sanji's character philosophy that will be central to his identity throughout the series - never refusing food to the starving.

quotes.text: When people are hungry, I offer them food. That's all there is to it.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji explaining his philosophy while defying the staff's objections

events.title: Krieg Devours the Food
events.description: Don Krieg hungrily consumes the fried rice that Sanji prepared, quickly regaining his strength. His desperate eating shows the severity of his starvation after being defeated in the Grand Line.
events.significance: Shows the immediate effects of Sanji's kindness while building tension for Krieg's inevitable betrayal. The scene emphasizes the pirate's desperation after his devastating encounter with Mihawk.

events.title: Krieg's Betrayal and Attack on Baratie
events.description: True to his reputation, Don Krieg immediately betrays the Baratie after eating. He reveals his true intentions - to take the restaurant ship for himself and demands food for 100 of his surviving crew members. When the staff refuses, Krieg deploys hidden firearms from his golden armor and opens fire.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Baratie battle arc's climax. Confirms Krieg as a major villain and demonstrates his ruthless, dishonorable nature. Despite Sanji's compassion, Krieg shows no gratitude.

quotes.text: Did you really think I'd keep my word? I'm a pirate! Now bring me food for 100 men and hand over this ship!
quotes.speaker: Don Krieg
quotes.context: Krieg revealing his betrayal after regaining strength

events.title: Krieg's Armored Arsenal Revealed
events.description: Don Krieg demonstrates the capabilities of his golden wootz steel armor, revealing multiple hidden weapons including firearms and other armaments. The armor proves impervious to the Baratie cooks' attacks.
events.significance: Establishes Krieg as a formidable opponent whose strength comes from superior weaponry and technology rather than Devil Fruit powers or martial arts skill. Shows the variety of combat styles in One Piece beyond supernatural abilities.

events.title: Zeff Agrees to Krieg's Demands
events.description: Faced with Krieg's overwhelming firepower and threats to destroy the restaurant, Zeff reluctantly agrees to provide food for Krieg's crew to prevent bloodshed and protect his staff.
events.significance: Shows Zeff's pragmatic leadership and his priority of protecting his people over pride. Demonstrates the difficult position the Baratie is in against a superior military force.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's defining philosophy when deciding to feed Don Krieg

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between Sanji's compassionate philosophy of feeding the hungry and the practical danger of helping a known villain. Sanji's idealism is tested when his kindness is immediately exploited.
themes.symbolism: The food represents mercy and humanity, while Krieg's betrayal represents the harsh reality of the pirate world where kindness can be seen as weakness.

themes.description: Don Krieg's methods contrast sharply with traditional notions of honor. His willingness to use any means to win, including begging and betrayal, establishes him as a pragmatic but dishonorable villain.
themes.symbolism: Krieg's golden armor symbolizes false glory - impressive on the outside but hollow of true strength or honor.

themes.description: Sanji's unwavering commitment to feeding the hungry, regardless of who they are, is a central theme. This episode establishes this as a core principle that defines his character.
themes.symbolism: Food as a universal human need that transcends allegiances and conflicts.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's core philosophy about feeding the hungry is tested and affirmed, even when faced with betrayal. His compassion is shown to be genuine and unwavering, not naive.

trivia.fact: Don Krieg's bounty of 17,000,000 berries was the highest bounty revealed in the series up to this point.
This episode adapts chapters 46-47 of the manga.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Luffy and Sanji.
Don Krieg is one of the few major East Blue villains who does not have a Devil Fruit power, relying instead on weapons and military tactics.
